capsules_submitted.utterance: So Flitwick is an adult, huh? I've always thought he was a bit of a young-at-heart kind of guy, but I guess that's not the case. He's definitely got some wisdom and experience under his belt now.

capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape's affiliation with Hogwarts is a well-known fact. He was indeed the Potions master during my time there. I remember him being quite intimidating, but also had a certain... complexity to him.
capsules_submitted.reply: i am glad to have learned something new. i've never heard of professor snape before, can you tell me more about him?

capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape does have that distinctive hook for a nose. I've always found it quite striking, to be honest. (smiling slightly)

capsules_submitted.utterance: You're talking about Hagrid's teeth. I'm pretty sure he lost them to those hunters. It's a confirmed fact that they were the ones who attacked him and took his teeth as proof of their encounter with him.

capsules_submitted.utterance: Hermione's affiliation with Hogwarts is a well-known fact. I'm pretty sure she attended the school there, and it's definitely confirmed by many sources. She's one of the brightest witches of our age, after all!

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was reading about Snape's family history and it turns out he has a pretty complicated lineage. His mother, Eileen Prince, was a witch, but his father, Tobias Snape, was a Muggle. That's right, a non-magical person. It's interesting to think about how that might have affected him growing up.
